Independent, the.translation[0].definiti: a serious British newspaper which generally supports liberal political ideas. The same company produces a similar paper on Sundays, called the Independent on Sunday.
Independent, the.translation[1].definiti: not owned/controlled by something
an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government
independent film (=one not made or produced by a large film production company)
There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
an independent charity
small independent bookshops
schools in the independent sector
independent television companies
independent television/radio/broadcasting etc
We need a central bank that is independent of the government.
independent of
an independent organization or person is not involved in a particular situation, and can therefore be trusted to be fair in judging it
an independent panel of scientists
An independent body  (=group of people who work together) has been set up to monitor government spending.
There were no independent witnesses to the shooting.
Human rights groups have called for an independent inquiry into the killings.
independent inquiry/advice/opinion etc
the results of an independent study
independent inquiry/advice/opinion etc
country
an independent country is not governed or controlled by another country
India became independent in 1947.
confident and able to do things by yourself in your own way, without needing help or advice from other people
Now that my sons are more independent, I have more time for myself.
an independent young woman
Heâ€™s helping other people with spinal injuries to lead an independent life.
By this age, the child becomes relatively independent of his mother.
independent of
having enough money to live, without having to ask for help from other people
It was always very important to me to be financially independent.
Robert aimed to be independent of his parents by the time he was twenty.
independent of
separate
if one thing is independent of another, the two are not connected, or the second thing does not influence the first
Three independent studies all arrived at the same conclusion.
reports from two separate sources entirely independent of one another
independent of
politician
an independent politician does not belong to a particular party
Independent candidates won three seats.
Independent, the.translation[2].definiti: a politician who does not belong to a political party
Independent, the.translation[3].definiti: not owned, controlled, or financed by another organization or the government
There are plans to split the company into a number of smaller independent companies.
